qas.question: What Was estimated amount of deaths during the war?
What percent of the deaths during the war were civilians?
What countries suffered the most casualties in the war?

answers.text: The former Soviet Union and China

qas.question: What percentage of it's population did Poland lose in the war?
How many deaths did the Soviet Union suffer in the war?

context: It is possible that around <a0_0>62 million<a0_0/> people died in the war; estimates vary greatly. <a1_0>About 60%<a1_0/> of all casualties were civilians, who died as a result of disease, starvation, genocide (in particular, the Holocaust), and aerial bombing. <a2_0>The former Soviet Union and China<a2_0/> suffered the most casualties. Estimates place deaths in the Soviet Union at around <a4_0>23 million<a4_0/>, while China suffered about 10 million. No country lost a greater portion of its population than Poland: approximately 5.6 million, or <a3_0>16%,<a3_0/> of its pre-war population of 34.8 million died.
